name: HAMLET
line: A whole one, I.

name: HAMLET
line: For thou dost know, O Damon dear,

name: HAMLET
line: This realm dismantled was

name: HAMLET
line: Of Jove himself, and now reigns here

name: HAMLET
line: A very, very--pajock.

name: HORATIO
line: You might have rhymed.

name: HAMLET
line: O good Horatio, I'll take the ghost's word for a

name: HAMLET
line: thousand pound. Didst perceive?

name: HORATIO
line: Very well, my lord.

name: HAMLET
line: Upon the talk of the poisoning?

name: HORATIO
line: I did very well note him.

name: HAMLET
line: Ah, ha! Come, some music! come, the recorders!

name: HAMLET
line: For if the king like not the comedy,

name: HAMLET
line: Why then, belike, he likes it not, perdy.

name: HAMLET
line: Come, some music!

name: HAMLET
line: Re-enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: Good my lord, vouchsafe me a word with you.

name: HAMLET
line: Sir, a whole history.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: The king, sir,--

name: HAMLET
line: Ay, sir, what of him?

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: Is in his retirement marvellous distempered.

name: HAMLET
line: With drink, sir?

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: No, my lord, rather with choler.

name: HAMLET
line: Your wisdom should show itself more richer to

name: HAMLET
line: signify this to his doctor, for, for me to put him

name: HAMLET
line: to his purgation would perhaps plunge him into far

name: HAMLET
line: more choler.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: Good my lord, put your discourse into some frame and

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: start not so wildly from my affair.

name: HAMLET
line: I am tame, sir: pronounce.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: The queen, your mother, in most great affliction of

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: spirit, hath sent me to you.

name: HAMLET
line: You are welcome.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: Nay, good my lord, this courtesy is not of the right

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: breed. If it shall please you to make me a

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: wholesome answer, I will do your mother's

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: commandment: if not, your pardon and my return

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: shall be the end of my business.

name: HAMLET
line: Sir, I cannot.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: What, my lord?

name: HAMLET
line: Make you a wholesome answer, my wit's diseased: but,

name: HAMLET
line: sir, such answer as I can make, you shall command,

name: HAMLET
line: or, rather, as you say, my mother: therefore no

name: HAMLET
line: more, but to the matter: my mother, you say,--

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Then thus she says, your behavior hath struck her

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: into amazement and admiration.

name: HAMLET
line: O wonderful son, that can so astonish a mother! But

name: HAMLET
line: is there no sequel at the heels of this mother's

name: HAMLET
line: admiration? Impart.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: She desires to speak with you in her closet, ere you

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: go to bed.

name: HAMLET
line: We shall obey, were she ten times our mother. Have

name: HAMLET
line: you any further trade with us?

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: My lord, you once did love me.

name: HAMLET
line: So I do still, by these pickers and stealers.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Good my lord, what is your cause of distemper? you

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: do, surely, bar the door upon your own liberty, if

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: you deny your griefs to your friend.

name: HAMLET
line: Sir, I lack advancement.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: How can that be, when you have the voice of the king

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: himself for your succession in Denmark?

name: HAMLET
line: Ay, but sir, 'While the grass grows,'--the proverb

name: HAMLET
line: is something musty.

name: HAMLET
line: Re-enter Players with recorders

name: HAMLET
line: O, the recorders! let me see one. To withdraw with

name: HAMLET
line: you:--why do you go about to recover the wind of me,

name: HAMLET
line: as if you would drive me into a toil?

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: O, my lord, if my duty be too bold, my love is too

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: unmannerly.

name: HAMLET
line: I do not well understand that. Will you play upon

name: HAMLET
line: this pipe?

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: My lord, I cannot.

name: HAMLET
line: I pray you.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: Believe me, I cannot.

name: HAMLET
line: I do beseech you.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: I know no touch of it, my lord.

name: HAMLET
line: 'Tis as easy as lying: govern these ventages with

name: HAMLET
line: your lingers and thumb, give it breath with your

name: HAMLET
line: mouth, and it will discourse most eloquent music.

name: HAMLET
line: Look you, these are the stops.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: But these cannot I command to any utterance of

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: harmony, I have not the skill.

name: HAMLET
line: Why, look you now, how unworthy a thing you make of

name: HAMLET
line: me! You would play upon me, you would seem to know

name: HAMLET
line: my stops, you would pluck out the heart of my

name: HAMLET
line: mystery, you would sound me from my lowest note to

name: HAMLET
line: the top of my compass: and there is much music,

name: HAMLET
line: excellent voice, in this little organ, yet cannot

name: HAMLET
line: you make it speak. 'Sblood, do you think I am

name: HAMLET
line: easier to be played on than a pipe? Call me what

name: HAMLET
line: instrument you will, though you can fret me, yet you

name: HAMLET
line: cannot play upon me.

name: HAMLET
line: Enter POLONIUS

name: HAMLET
line: God bless you, sir!

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: My lord, the queen would speak with you, and

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: presently.

name: HAMLET
line: Do you see yonder cloud that's almost in shape of a camel?

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: By the mass, and 'tis like a camel, indeed.

name: HAMLET
line: Methinks it is like a weasel.

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: It is backed like a weasel.

name: HAMLET
line: Or like a whale?

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: Very like a whale.

name: HAMLET
line: Then I will come to my mother by and by. They fool

name: HAMLET
line: me to the top of my bent. I will come by and by.

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: I will say so.

name: HAMLET
line: By and by is easily said.

name: HAMLET
line: Exit POLONIUS

name: HAMLET
line: Leave me, friends.

name: HAMLET
line: Exeunt all but HAMLET

name: HAMLET
line: Tis now the very witching time of night,

name: HAMLET
line: When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out

name: HAMLET
line: Contagion to this world: now could I drink hot blood,

name: HAMLET
line: And do such bitter business as the day

name: HAMLET
line: Would quake to look on. Soft! now to my mother.

name: HAMLET
line: O heart, lose not thy nature, let not ever

name: HAMLET
line: The soul of Nero enter this firm bosom:

name: HAMLET
line: Let me be cruel, not unnatural:

name: HAMLET
line: I will speak daggers to her, but use none,

name: HAMLET
line: My tongue and soul in this be hypocrites,

name: HAMLET
line: How in my words soever she be shent,

name: HAMLET
line: To give them seals never, my soul, consent!

name: HAMLET
line: Exit

name: HAMLET
line: SCENE III. A room in the castle.

name: HAMLET
line: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: I like him not, nor stands it safe with us

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To let his madness range. Therefore prepare you,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: I your commission will forthwith dispatch,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And he to England shall along with you:

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The terms of our estate may not endure

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Hazard so dangerous as doth hourly grow

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Out of his lunacies.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: We will ourselves provide:

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: Most holy and religious fear it is

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: To keep those many many bodies safe

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: That live and feed upon your majesty.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: The single and peculiar life is bound,

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: With all the strength and armour of the mind,

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: To keep itself from noyance, but much more

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: That spirit upon whose weal depend and rest

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: The lives of many. The cease of majesty

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Dies not alone, but, like a gulf, doth draw

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: What's near it with it: it is a massy wheel,

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Fix'd on the summit of the highest mount,

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: To whose huge spokes ten thousand lesser things

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Are mortised and adjoin'd, which, when it falls,

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Each small annexment, petty consequence,

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Attends the boisterous ruin. Never alone

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Did the king sigh, but with a general groan.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Arm you, I pray you, to this speedy voyage,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: For we will fetters put upon this fear,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Which now goes too free-footed.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: We will haste us.

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: Enter POLONIUS

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: My lord, he's going to his mother's closet:

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: Behind the arras I'll convey myself,

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: To hear the process, and warrant she'll tax him home:

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: And, as you said, and wisely was it said,

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'Tis meet that some more audience than a mother,

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: Since nature makes them partial, should o'erhear

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: The speech, of vantage. Fare you well, my liege:

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: I'll call upon you ere you go to bed,

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: And tell you what I know.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Thanks, dear my lord.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Exit POLONIUS

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: O, my offence is rank it smells to heaven,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: It hath the primal eldest curse upon't,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: A brother's murder. Pray can I not,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Though inclination be as sharp as will:

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: My stronger guilt defeats my strong intent,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And, like a man to double business bound,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: I stand in pause where I shall first begin,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And both neglect. What if this cursed hand

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Were thicker than itself with brother's blood,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Is there not rain enough in the sweet heavens

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To wash it white as snow? Whereto serves mercy

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But to confront the visage of offence?

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And what's in prayer but this two-fold force,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To be forestalled ere we come to fall,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Or pardon'd being down? Then I'll look up,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: My fault is past. But, O, what form of prayer

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Can serve my turn? 'Forgive me my foul murder'?

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That cannot be, since I am still possess'd

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Of those effects for which I did the murder,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: My crown, mine own ambition and my queen.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: May one be pardon'd and retain the offence?

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: In the corrupted currents of this world

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Offence's gilded hand may shove by justice,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And oft 'tis seen the wicked prize itself

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Buys out the law: but 'tis not so above,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: There is no shuffling, there the action lies

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: In his true nature, and we ourselves compell'd,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Even to the teeth and forehead of our faults,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To give in evidence. What then? what rests?

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Try what repentance can: what can it not?

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Yet what can it when one can not repent?

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: O wretched state! O bosom black as death!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: O limed soul, that, struggling to be free,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Art more engaged! Help, angels! Make assay!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Bow, stubborn knees, and, heart with strings of steel,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Be soft as sinews of the newborn babe!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: All may be well.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Retires and kneels

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Enter HAMLET

name: HAMLET
line: Now might I do it pat, now he is praying,

name: HAMLET
line: And now I'll do't. And so he goes to heaven,

name: HAMLET
line: And so am I revenged. That would be scann'd:

name: HAMLET
line: A villain kills my father, and for that,

name: HAMLET
line: I, his sole son, do this same villain send

name: HAMLET
line: To heaven.

name: HAMLET
line: O, this is hire and salary, not revenge.

name: HAMLET
line: He took my father grossly, full of bread,

name: HAMLET
line: With all his crimes broad blown, as flush as May,

name: HAMLET
line: And how his audit stands who knows save heaven?

name: HAMLET
line: But in our circumstance and course of thought,

name: HAMLET
line: 'Tis heavy with him: and am I then revenged,

name: HAMLET
line: To take him in the purging of his soul,

name: HAMLET
line: When he is fit and season'd for his passage?

name: HAMLET
line: No!

name: HAMLET
line: Up, sword, and know thou a more horrid hent:

name: HAMLET
line: When he is drunk asleep, or in his rage,

name: HAMLET
line: Or in the incestuous pleasure of his bed,

name: HAMLET
line: At gaming, swearing, or about some act

name: HAMLET
line: That has no relish of salvation in't,

name: HAMLET
line: Then trip him, that his heels may kick at heaven,

name: HAMLET
line: And that his soul may be as damn'd and black

name: HAMLET
line: As hell, whereto it goes. My mother stays:

name: HAMLET
line: This physic but prolongs thy sickly days.

name: HAMLET
line: Exit

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: [Rising]  My words fly up, my thoughts remain below:

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Words without thoughts never to heaven go.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Exit

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: SCENE IV. The Queen's closet.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE and POLONIUS

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: He will come straight. Look you lay home to him:

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: Tell him his pranks have been too broad to bear with,

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: And that your grace hath screen'd and stood between

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: Much heat and him. I'll sconce me even here.

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: Pray you, be round with him.

name: HAMLET
line: [Within]  Mother, mother, mother!

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: I'll warrant you,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Fear me not: withdraw, I hear him coming.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: POLONIUS hides behind the arras

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Enter HAMLET

name: HAMLET
line: Now, mother, what's the matter?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Hamlet, thou hast thy father much offended.

name: HAMLET
line: Mother, you have my father much offended.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Come, come, you answer with an idle tongue.

name: HAMLET
line: Go, go, you question with a wicked tongue.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Why, how now, Hamlet!

name: HAMLET
line: What's the matter now?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Have you forgot me?

name: HAMLET
line: No, by the rood, not so:

name: HAMLET
line: You are the queen, your husband's brother's wife,

name: HAMLET
line: And--would it were not so!--you are my mother.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Nay, then, I'll set those to you that can speak.

name: HAMLET
line: Come, come, and sit you down, you shall not budge,

name: HAMLET
line: You go not till I set you up a glass

name: HAMLET
line: Where you may see the inmost part of you.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: What wilt thou do? thou wilt not murder me?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Help, help, ho!

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: [Behind]  What, ho! help, help, help!

name: HAMLET
line: [Drawing]  How now! a rat? Dead, for a ducat, dead!

name: HAMLET
line: Makes a pass through the arras

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: [Behind]  O, I am slain!

name: LORD POLONIUS
line: Falls and dies

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: O me, what hast thou done?

name: HAMLET
line: Nay, I know not:

name: HAMLET
line: Is it the king?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: O, what a rash and bloody deed is this!

name: HAMLET
line: A bloody deed! almost as bad, good mother,

name: HAMLET
line: As kill a king, and marry with his brother.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: As kill a king!

name: HAMLET
line: Ay, lady, 'twas my word.

name: HAMLET
line: Lifts up the array and discovers POLONIUS

name: HAMLET
line: Thou wretched, rash, intruding fool, farewell!

name: HAMLET
line: I took thee for thy better: take thy fortune,

name: HAMLET
line: Thou find'st to be too busy is some danger.

name: HAMLET
line: Leave wringing of your hands: peace! sit you down,

name: HAMLET
line: And let me wring your heart, for so I shall,

name: HAMLET
line: If it be made of penetrable stuff,

name: HAMLET
line: If damned custom have not brass'd it so

name: HAMLET
line: That it is proof and bulwark against sense.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: What have I done, that thou darest wag thy tongue

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: In noise so rude against me?

name: HAMLET
line: Such an act

name: HAMLET
line: That blurs the grace and blush of modesty,

name: HAMLET
line: Calls virtue hypocrite, takes off the rose

name: HAMLET
line: From the fair forehead of an innocent love

name: HAMLET
line: And sets a blister there, makes marriage-vows

name: HAMLET
line: As false as dicers' oaths: O, such a deed

name: HAMLET
line: As from the body of contraction plucks

name: HAMLET
line: The very soul, and sweet religion makes

name: HAMLET
line: A rhapsody of words: heaven's face doth glow:

name: HAMLET
line: Yea, this solidity and compound mass,

name: HAMLET
line: With tristful visage, as against the doom,

name: HAMLET
line: Is thought-sick at the act.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Ay me, what act,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: That roars so loud, and thunders in the index?

name: HAMLET
line: Look here, upon this picture, and on this,

name: HAMLET
line: The counterfeit presentment of two brothers.

name: HAMLET
line: See, what a grace was seated on this brow,

name: HAMLET
line: Hyperion's curls, the front of Jove himself,

name: HAMLET
line: An eye like Mars, to threaten and command,

name: HAMLET
line: A station like the herald Mercury

name: HAMLET
line: New-lighted on a heaven-kissing hill,

name: HAMLET
line: A combination and a form indeed,

name: HAMLET
line: Where every god did seem to set his seal,

name: HAMLET
line: To give the world assurance of a man:

name: HAMLET
line: This was your husband. Look you now, what follows:

name: HAMLET
line: Here is your husband, like a mildew'd ear,

name: HAMLET
line: Blasting his wholesome brother. Have you eyes?

name: HAMLET
line: Could you on this fair mountain leave to feed,

name: HAMLET
line: And batten on this moor? Ha! have you eyes?

name: HAMLET
line: You cannot call it love, for at your age

name: HAMLET
line: The hey-day in the blood is tame, it's humble,

name: HAMLET
line: And waits upon the judgment: and what judgment

name: HAMLET
line: Would step from this to this? Sense, sure, you have,

name: HAMLET
line: Else could you not have motion, but sure, that sense

name: HAMLET
line: Is apoplex'd, for madness would not err,

name: HAMLET
line: Nor sense to ecstasy was ne'er so thrall'd

name: HAMLET
line: But it reserved some quantity of choice,

name: HAMLET
line: To serve in such a difference. What devil was't

name: HAMLET
line: That thus hath cozen'd you at hoodman-blind?

name: HAMLET
line: Eyes without feeling, feeling without sight,

name: HAMLET
line: Ears without hands or eyes, smelling sans all,

name: HAMLET
line: Or but a sickly part of one true sense

name: HAMLET
line: Could not so mope.

name: HAMLET
line: O shame! where is thy blush? Rebellious hell,

name: HAMLET
line: If thou canst mutine in a matron's bones,

name: HAMLET
line: To flaming youth let virtue be as wax,

name: HAMLET
line: And melt in her own fire: proclaim no shame

name: HAMLET
line: When the compulsive ardour gives the charge,

name: HAMLET
line: Since frost itself as actively doth burn

name: HAMLET
line: And reason panders will.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: O Hamlet, speak no more:

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Thou turn'st mine eyes into my very soul,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: And there I see such black and grained spots

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: As will not leave their tinct.

name: HAMLET
line: Nay, but to live

name: HAMLET
line: In the rank sweat of an enseamed bed,

name: HAMLET
line: Stew'd in corruption, honeying and making love

name: HAMLET
line: Over the nasty sty,--

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: O, speak to me no more,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: These words, like daggers, enter in mine ears,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: No more, sweet Hamlet!

name: HAMLET
line: A murderer and a villain,

name: HAMLET
line: A slave that is not twentieth part the tithe

name: HAMLET
line: Of your precedent lord, a vice of kings,

name: HAMLET
line: A cutpurse of the empire and the rule,

name: HAMLET
line: That from a shelf the precious diadem stole,

name: HAMLET
line: And put it in his pocket!

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: No more!

name: HAMLET
line: A king of shreds and patches,--

name: HAMLET
line: Enter Ghost

name: HAMLET
line: Save me, and hover o'er me with your wings,

name: HAMLET
line: You heavenly guards! What would your gracious figure?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Alas, he's mad!

name: HAMLET
line: Do you not come your tardy son to chide,

name: HAMLET
line: That, lapsed in time and passion, lets go by

name: HAMLET
line: The important acting of your dread command? O, say!

name: Ghost
line: Do not forget: this visitation

name: Ghost
line: Is but to whet thy almost blunted purpose.

name: Ghost
line: But, look, amazement on thy mother sits:

name: Ghost
line: O, step between her and her fighting soul:

name: Ghost
line: Conceit in weakest bodies strongest works:

name: Ghost
line: Speak to her, Hamlet.

name: HAMLET
line: How is it with you, lady?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Alas, how is't with you,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: That you do bend your eye on vacancy

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: And with the incorporal air do hold discourse?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Forth at your eyes your spirits wildly peep,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: And, as the sleeping soldiers in the alarm,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Your bedded hair, like life in excrements,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Starts up, and stands on end. O gentle son,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Upon the heat and flame of thy distemper

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Sprinkle cool patience. Whereon do you look?

name: HAMLET
line: On him, on him! Look you, how pale he glares!

name: HAMLET
line: His form and cause conjoin'd, preaching to stones,

name: HAMLET
line: Would make them capable. Do not look upon me,

name: HAMLET
line: Lest with this piteous action you convert

name: HAMLET
line: My stern effects: then what I have to do

name: HAMLET
line: Will want true colour, tears perchance for blood.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: To whom do you speak this?

name: HAMLET
line: Do you see nothing there?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Nothing at all, yet all that is I see.

name: HAMLET
line: Nor did you nothing hear?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: No, nothing but ourselves.

name: HAMLET
line: Why, look you there! look, how it steals away!

name: HAMLET
line: My father, in his habit as he lived!

name: HAMLET
line: Look, where he goes, even now, out at the portal!

name: HAMLET
line: Exit Ghost

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: This the very coinage of your brain:

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: This bodiless creation ecstasy

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Is very cunning in.

name: HAMLET
line: Ecstasy!

name: HAMLET
line: My pulse, as yours, doth temperately keep time,

name: HAMLET
line: And makes as healthful music: it is not madness

name: HAMLET
line: That I have utter'd: bring me to the test,

name: HAMLET
line: And I the matter will re-word, which madness

name: HAMLET
line: Would gambol from. Mother, for love of grace,

name: HAMLET
line: Lay not that mattering unction to your soul,

name: HAMLET
line: That not your trespass, but my madness speaks:

name: HAMLET
line: It will but skin and film the ulcerous place,

name: HAMLET
line: Whilst rank corruption, mining all within,

name: HAMLET
line: Infects unseen. Confess yourself to heaven,

name: HAMLET
line: Repent what's past, avoid what is to come,

name: HAMLET
line: And do not spread the compost on the weeds,

name: HAMLET
line: To make them ranker. Forgive me this my virtue,

name: HAMLET
line: For in the fatness of these pursy times

name: HAMLET
line: Virtue itself of vice must pardon beg,

name: HAMLET
line: Yea, curb and woo for leave to do him good.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: O Hamlet, thou hast cleft my heart in twain.

name: HAMLET
line: O, throw away the worser part of it,

name: HAMLET
line: And live the purer with the other half.

name: HAMLET
line: Good night: but go not to mine uncle's bed,

name: HAMLET
line: Assume a virtue, if you have it not.

name: HAMLET
line: That monster, custom, who all sense doth eat,

name: HAMLET
line: Of habits devil, is angel yet in this,

name: HAMLET
line: That to the use of actions fair and good

name: HAMLET
line: He likewise gives a frock or livery,

name: HAMLET
line: That aptly is put on. Refrain to-night,

name: HAMLET
line: And that shall lend a kind of easiness

name: HAMLET
line: To the next abstinence: the next more easy,

name: HAMLET
line: For use almost can change the stamp of nature,

name: HAMLET
line: And either [         ] the devil, or throw him out

name: HAMLET
line: With wondrous potency. Once more, good night:

name: HAMLET
line: And when you are desirous to be bless'd,

name: HAMLET
line: I'll blessing beg of you. For this same lord,

name: HAMLET
line: Pointing to POLONIUS

name: HAMLET
line: I do repent: but heaven hath pleased it so,

name: HAMLET
line: To punish me with this and this with me,

name: HAMLET
line: That I must be their scourge and minister.

name: HAMLET
line: I will bestow him, and will answer well

name: HAMLET
line: The death I gave him. So, again, good night.

name: HAMLET
line: I must be cruel, only to be kind:

name: HAMLET
line: Thus bad begins and worse remains behind.

name: HAMLET
line: One word more, good lady.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: What shall I do?

name: HAMLET
line: Not this, by no means, that I bid you do:

name: HAMLET
line: Let the bloat king tempt you again to bed,

name: HAMLET
line: Pinch wanton on your cheek, call you his mouse,

name: HAMLET
line: And let him, for a pair of reechy kisses,

name: HAMLET
line: Or paddling in your neck with his damn'd fingers,

name: HAMLET
line: Make you to ravel all this matter out,

name: HAMLET
line: That I essentially am not in madness,

name: HAMLET
line: But mad in craft. 'Twere good you let him know,

name: HAMLET
line: For who, that's but a queen, fair, sober, wise,

name: HAMLET
line: Would from a paddock, from a bat, a gib,

name: HAMLET
line: Such dear concernings hide? who would do so?

name: HAMLET
line: No, in despite of sense and secrecy,

name: HAMLET
line: Unpeg the basket on the house's top.

name: HAMLET
line: Let the birds fly, and, like the famous ape,

name: HAMLET
line: To try conclusions, in the basket creep,

name: HAMLET
line: And break your own neck down.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Be thou assured, if words be made of breath,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: And breath of life, I have no life to breathe

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: What thou hast said to me.

name: HAMLET
line: I must to England, you know that?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Alack,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: I had forgot: 'tis so concluded on.

name: HAMLET
line: There's letters seal'd: and my two schoolfellows,

name: HAMLET
line: Whom I will trust as I will adders fang'd,

name: HAMLET
line: They bear the mandate, they must sweep my way,

name: HAMLET
line: And marshal me to knavery. Let it work,

name: HAMLET
line: For 'tis the sport to have the engineer

name: HAMLET
line: Hoist with his own petard: and 't shall go hard

name: HAMLET
line: But I will delve one yard below their mines,

name: HAMLET
line: And blow them at the moon: O, 'tis most sweet,

name: HAMLET
line: When in one line two crafts directly meet.

name: HAMLET
line: This man shall set me packing:

name: HAMLET
line: I'll lug the guts into the neighbour room.

name: HAMLET
line: Mother, good night. Indeed this counsellor

name: HAMLET
line: Is now most still, most secret and most grave,

name: HAMLET
line: Who was in life a foolish prating knave.

name: HAMLET
line: Come, sir, to draw toward an end with you.

name: HAMLET
line: Good night, mother.

name: HAMLET
line: Exeunt severally, HAMLET dragging in POLONIUS

name: HAMLET
line: ACT IV

name: HAMLET
line: SCENE I. A room in the castle.

name: HAMLET
line: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: There's matter in these sighs, these profound heaves:

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: You must translate: 'tis fit we understand them.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Where is your son?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Bestow this place on us a little while.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Ah, my good lord, what have I seen to-night!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: What, Gertrude? How does Hamlet?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Mad as the sea and wind, when both contend

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Which is the mightier: in his lawless fit,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Behind the arras hearing something stir,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Whips out his rapier, cries, 'A rat, a rat!'

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: And, in this brainish apprehension, kills

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: The unseen good old man.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: O heavy deed!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: It had been so with us, had we been there:

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: His liberty is full of threats to all,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To you yourself, to us, to every one.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Alas, how shall this bloody deed be answer'd?

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: It will be laid to us, whose providence

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Should have kept short, restrain'd and out of haunt,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: This mad young man: but so much was our love,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: We would not understand what was most fit,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But, like the owner of a foul disease,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To keep it from divulging, let it feed

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Even on the pith of Life. Where is he gone?

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: To draw apart the body he hath kill'd:

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: O'er whom his very madness, like some ore

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Among a mineral of metals base,

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Shows itself pure, he weeps for what is done.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: O Gertrude, come away!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The sun no sooner shall the mountains touch,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But we will ship him hence: and this vile deed

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: We must, with all our majesty and skill,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Both countenance and excuse. Ho, Guildenstern!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Re-enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Friends both, go join you with some further aid:

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Hamlet in madness hath Polonius slain,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And from his mother's closet hath he dragg'd him:

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Go seek him out, speak fair, and bring the body

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Into the chapel. I pray you, haste in this.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Come, Gertrude, we'll call up our wisest friends,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And let them know, both what we mean to do,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And what's untimely done. O, come away!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: My soul is full of discord and dismay.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Exeunt

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: SCENE II. Another room in the castle.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Enter HAMLET

name: HAMLET
line: Safely stowed.

name: HAMLET
line: ROSENCRANTZ:

name: HAMLET
line: GUILDENSTERN:

name: HAMLET
line: [Within]  Hamlet! Lord Hamlet!

name: HAMLET
line: What noise? who calls on Hamlet?

name: HAMLET
line: O, here they come.

name: HAMLET
line: Enter ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: What have you done, my lord, with the dead body?

name: HAMLET
line: Compounded it with dust, whereto 'tis kin.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Tell us where 'tis, that we may take it thence

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: And bear it to the chapel.

name: HAMLET
line: Do not believe it.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Believe what?

name: HAMLET
line: That I can keep your counsel and not mine own.

name: HAMLET
line: Besides, to be demanded of a sponge! what

name: HAMLET
line: replication should be made by the son of a king?

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Take you me for a sponge, my lord?

name: HAMLET
line: Ay, sir, that soaks up the king's countenance, his

name: HAMLET
line: rewards, his authorities. But such officers do the

name: HAMLET
line: king best service in the end: he keeps them, like

name: HAMLET
line: an ape, in the corner of his jaw, first mouthed, to

name: HAMLET
line: be last swallowed: when he needs what you have

name: HAMLET
line: gleaned, it is but squeezing you, and, sponge, you

name: HAMLET
line: shall be dry again.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: I understand you not, my lord.

name: HAMLET
line: I am glad of it: a knavish speech sleeps in a

name: HAMLET
line: foolish ear.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: My lord, you must tell us where the body is, and go

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: with us to the king.

name: HAMLET
line: The body is with the king, but the king is not with

name: HAMLET
line: the body. The king is a thing--

name: GUILDENSTERN
line: A thing, my lord!

name: HAMLET
line: Of nothing: bring me to him. Hide fox, and all after.

name: HAMLET
line: Exeunt

name: HAMLET
line: SCENE III. Another room in the castle.

name: HAMLET
line: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, attended

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: I have sent to seek him, and to find the body.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: How dangerous is it that this man goes loose!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Yet must not we put the strong law on him:

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: He's loved of the distracted multitude,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Who like not in their judgment, but their eyes,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And where tis so, the offender's scourge is weigh'd,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But never the offence. To bear all smooth and even,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: This sudden sending him away must seem

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Deliberate pause: diseases desperate grown

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: By desperate appliance are relieved,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Or not at all.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Enter ROSENCRANTZ

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: How now! what hath befall'n?

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Where the dead body is bestow'd, my lord,

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: We cannot get from him.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But where is he?

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Without, my lord, guarded, to know your pleasure.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Bring him before us.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Ho, Guildenstern! bring in my lord.

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Enter HAMLET and GUILDENSTERN

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Now, Hamlet, where's Polonius?

name: HAMLET
line: At supper.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: At supper! where?

name: HAMLET
line: Not where he eats, but where he is eaten: a certain

name: HAMLET
line: convocation of politic worms are e'en at him. Your

name: HAMLET
line: worm is your only emperor for diet: we fat all

name: HAMLET
line: creatures else to fat us, and we fat ourselves for

name: HAMLET
line: maggots: your fat king and your lean beggar is but

name: HAMLET
line: variable service, two dishes, but to one table:

name: HAMLET
line: that's the end.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Alas, alas!

name: HAMLET
line: A man may fish with the worm that hath eat of a

name: HAMLET
line: king, and cat of the fish that hath fed of that worm.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: What dost you mean by this?

name: HAMLET
line: Nothing but to show you how a king may go a

name: HAMLET
line: progress through the guts of a beggar.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Where is Polonius?

name: HAMLET
line: In heaven, send hither to see: if your messenger

name: HAMLET
line: find him not there, seek him i' the other place

name: HAMLET
line: yourself. But indeed, if you find him not within

name: HAMLET
line: this month, you shall nose him as you go up the

name: HAMLET
line: stairs into the lobby.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Go seek him there.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To some Attendants

name: HAMLET
line: He will stay till ye come.

name: HAMLET
line: Exeunt Attendants

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Hamlet, this deed, for thine especial safety,--

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Which we do tender, as we dearly grieve

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: For that which thou hast done,--must send thee hence

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: With fiery quickness: therefore prepare thyself,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The bark is ready, and the wind at help,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The associates tend, and every thing is bent

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: For England.

name: HAMLET
line: For England!

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Ay, Hamlet.

name: HAMLET
line: Good.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: So is it, if thou knew'st our purposes.

name: HAMLET
line: I see a cherub that sees them. But, come, for

name: HAMLET
line: England! Farewell, dear mother.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Thy loving father, Hamlet.

name: HAMLET
line: My mother: father and mother is man and wife, man

name: HAMLET
line: and wife is one flesh, and so, my mother. Come, for England!

name: HAMLET
line: Exit

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Follow him at foot, tempt him with speed aboard,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Delay it not, I'll have him hence to-night:

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Away! for every thing is seal'd and done

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That else leans on the affair: pray you, make haste.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And, England, if my love thou hold'st at aught--

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: As my great power thereof may give thee sense,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Since yet thy cicatrice looks raw and red

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: After the Danish sword, and thy free awe

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Pays homage to us--thou mayst not coldly set

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Our sovereign process, which imports at full,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: By letters congruing to that effect,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The present death of Hamlet. Do it, England,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: For like the hectic in my blood he rages,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And thou must cure me: till I know 'tis done,

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Howe'er my haps, my joys were ne'er begun.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Exit

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: SCENE IV. A plain in Denmark.

name: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Enter FORTINBRAS, a Captain, and Soldiers, marching

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: Go, captain, from me greet the Danish king,

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: Tell him that, by his licence, Fortinbras

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: Craves the conveyance of a promised march

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: Over his kingdom. You know the rendezvous.

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: If that his majesty would aught with us,

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: We shall express our duty in his eye,

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: And let him know so.

name: Captain
line: I will do't, my lord.

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: Go softly on.

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: Exeunt FORTINBRAS and Soldiers

name: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
line: Enter HAMLET, ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and others

name: HAMLET
line: Good sir, whose powers are these?

name: Captain
line: They are of Norway, sir.

name: HAMLET
line: How purposed, sir, I pray you?

name: Captain
line: Against some part of Poland.

name: HAMLET
line: Who commands them, sir?

name: Captain
line: The nephews to old Norway, Fortinbras.

name: HAMLET
line: Goes it against the main of Poland, sir,

name: HAMLET
line: Or for some frontier?

name: Captain
line: Truly to speak, and with no addition,

name: Captain
line: We go to gain a little patch of ground

name: Captain
line: That hath in it no profit but the name.

name: Captain
line: To pay five ducats, five, I would not farm it,

name: Captain
line: Nor will it yield to Norway or the Pole

name: Captain
line: A ranker rate, should it be sold in fee.

name: HAMLET
line: Why, then the Polack never will defend it.

name: Captain
line: Yes, it is already garrison'd.

name: HAMLET
line: Two thousand souls and twenty thousand ducats

name: HAMLET
line: Will not debate the question of this straw:

name: HAMLET
line: This is the imposthume of much wealth and peace,

name: HAMLET
line: That inward breaks, and shows no cause without

name: HAMLET
line: Why the man dies. I humbly thank you, sir.

name: Captain
line: God be wi' you, sir.

name: Captain
line: Exit

name: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Wilt please you go, my lord?

name: HAMLET
line: I'll be with you straight go a little before.

name: HAMLET
line: Exeunt all except HAMLET

name: HAMLET
line: How all occasions do inform against me,

name: HAMLET
line: And spur my dull revenge! What is a man,

name: HAMLET
line: If his chief good and market of his time

name: HAMLET
line: Be but to sleep and feed? a beast, no more.

name: HAMLET
line: Sure, he that made us with such large discourse,

name: HAMLET
line: Looking before and after, gave us not

name: HAMLET
line: That capability and god-like reason

name: HAMLET
line: To fust in us unused. Now, whether it be

name: HAMLET
line: Bestial oblivion, or some craven scruple

name: HAMLET
line: Of thinking too precisely on the event,

name: HAMLET
line: A thought which, quarter'd, hath but one part wisdom

name: HAMLET
line: And ever three parts coward, I do not know

name: HAMLET
line: Why yet I live to say 'This thing's to do,'

name: HAMLET
line: Sith I have cause and will and strength and means

name: HAMLET
line: To do't. Examples gross as earth exhort me:

name: HAMLET
line: Witness this army of such mass and charge

name: HAMLET
line: Led by a delicate and tender prince,

name: HAMLET
line: Whose spirit with divine ambition puff'd

name: HAMLET
line: Makes mouths at the invisible event,

name: HAMLET
line: Exposing what is mortal and unsure

name: HAMLET
line: To all that fortune, death and danger dare,

name: HAMLET
line: Even for an egg-shell. Rightly to be great

name: HAMLET
line: Is not to stir without great argument,

name: HAMLET
line: But greatly to find quarrel in a straw

name: HAMLET
line: When honour's at the stake. How stand I then,

name: HAMLET
line: That have a father kill'd, a mother stain'd,

name: HAMLET
line: Excitements of my reason and my blood,

name: HAMLET
line: And let all sleep? while, to my shame, I see

name: HAMLET
line: The imminent death of twenty thousand men,

name: HAMLET
line: That, for a fantasy and trick of fame,

name: HAMLET
line: Go to their graves like beds, fight for a plot

name: HAMLET
line: Whereon the numbers cannot try the cause,

name: HAMLET
line: Which is not tomb enough and continent

name: HAMLET
line: To hide the slain? O, from this time forth,

name: HAMLET
line: My thoughts be bloody, or be nothing worth!

name: HAMLET
line: Exit

name: HAMLET
line: SCENE V. Elsinore. A room in the castle.

name: HAMLET
line: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE, HORATIO, and a Gentleman

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: I will not speak with her.

name: Gentleman
line: She is importunate, indeed distract:

name: Gentleman
line: Her mood will needs be pitied.

name: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: What would she have?

name: Gentleman
line: She speaks much of her father, says she hears

name: Gentleman
line: There's tricks i' the world, and hems, and beats her heart,

name: Gentleman
line: Spurns enviously at straws, speaks things in doubt,

name: Gentleman
line: That carry but half sense: her speech is nothing,

name: Gentleman
line: Yet the unshaped use of it doth move

name: Gentleman
line: The hearers to collection, they aim at it,

name: Gentleman
line: And botch the words up fit to their own thoughts,

name: Gentleman
line: Which, as her winks, and nods, and gestures

name: Gentleman
line: yield them,

name: Gentleman
line: Indeed would make one think there might be thought,

name: Gentleman
line: Though nothing sure, yet much unhappily.

name: HORATIO
